account.info.description: Retrieve information about the current account.

app.list.description: Retrieve a list of available applications. These refer to applications that can be launched when creating a Vultr VPS.

auth.info.description: Retrieve information about the current API key.

backup.list.description: List all backups on the current account.

params.description: Filter result set to only contain backups of this subscription object.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Filter result set to only contain this backup.
params.name: BACKUPID

baremetal.app_change.description: Reinstalls the bare metal server to a different Vultr one-click application. All data will be permanently lost.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Application to use. See /v1/baremetal/app_change_list.
params.name: APPID

baremetal.app_change_list.description: Retrieves a list of Vultr one-click applications to which a bare metal server can be changed. Always check against this list before trying to switch applications because it is not possible to switch between every application combination.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.bandwidth.description: Get the bandwidth used by a bare metal server.

baremetal.create.description: Create a new bare metal server. You will start being billed for this immediately. The response only contains the SUBID for the new machine.

params.description: Location in which to create the server. See v1/regions/list.
params.name: DCID

params.description: Plan to use when creating this server. See v1/plans/list_baremetal.
params.name: METALPLANID

params.description: Operating system to use. See v1/os/list.
params.name: OSID

params.description: The SCRIPTID of a startup script to execute on boot. This only works when using a Vultr supplied operating system. See v1/startupscript/list.
params.name: SCRIPTID

params.description: If you've selected the 'snapshot' operating system, this should be the SNAPSHOTID (see v1/snapshot/list) to restore for the initial installation.
params.name: SNAPSHOTID

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'.  If yes, an IPv6 subnet will be assigned to the server.
params.name: enable_ipv6

params.description: This is a text label that will be shown in the control panel.
params.name: label

params.description: List of SSH keys to apply to this server on install (only valid for Linux/FreeBSD). See v1/sshkey/list. Separate keys with commas.
params.name: SSHKEYID

params.description: If launching an application (OSID 186), this is the APPID to launch. See v1/app/list.
params.name: APPID

params.description: Base64 encoded user-data.
params.name: userdata

params.description: (optional, default 'yes') 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, an activation email will be sent when the server is ready.
params.name: notify_activate

params.description: The hostname to assign to this server.
params.name: hostname

params.description: The tag to assign to this server.
params.name: tag

params.description: IP address of the floating IP to use as the main IP of this server.
params.name: reserved_ip_v4

baremetal.destroy.description: Destroy (delete) a bare metal server. All data will be permanently lost, and the IP address will be released. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.get_app_info.description: Retrieves the application information for a bare metal server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.get_user_data.description: Retrieves the (base64 encoded) user-data for this subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.halt.description: Halt a bare metal server. This is a hard power off, meaning that the power to the machine is severed. The data on the machine will not be modified, and you will still be billed for the machine. To completely delete a machine, see v1/baremetal/destroy.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.ipv6_enable.description: Enables IPv6 networking on a bare metal server by assigning an IPv6 subnet to it. The server will not be rebooted when the subnet is assigned. It is possible to check whether or not IPv6 networking has been enabled with v1/baremetal/list_ipv6.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.label_set.description: Set the label of a bare metal server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: This is a text label that will be shown in the control panel.
params.name: label

baremetal.list.description: List all bare metal servers on the current account. This includes both pending and active servers.

params.description: Unique identifier of a subscription. Only the subscription object will be returned.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: A tag string. Only subscription objects with this tag will be returned.
params.name: tag

params.description: A text label string. Only subscription objects with this text label will be returned.
params.name: label

params.description: An IPv4 address. Only the subscription matching this IPv4 address will be returned.
params.name: main_ip

baremetal.list_ipv4.description: List the IPv4 information of a bare metal server. IP information is only available for bare metal servers in the "active" state.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.list_ipv6.description: List the IPv6 information of a bare metal server. IP information is only available for bare metal servers in the "active" state. If the bare metal server does not have IPv6 enabled, then an empty array is returned.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.os_change.description: Changes the bare metal server to a different operating system. All data will be permanently lost.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Operating system to use. See /v1/baremetal/os_change_list.
params.name: OSID

baremetal.os_change_list.description: Retrieves a list of operating systems to which a bare metal server can be changed. Always check against this list before trying to switch operating systems because it is not possible to switch between every operating system combination.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.reboot.description: Reboot a bare metal server. This is a hard reboot, which means that the server is powered off, then back on.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.reinstall.description: Reinstall the operating system on a bare metal server. All data will be permanently lost, but the IP address will remain the same. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

baremetal.set_user_data.description: Sets the user-data for this subscription. User-data is a generic data store, which some provisioning tools and cloud operating systems use as a configuration file. It is generally consumed only once after an instance has been launched, but individual needs may vary.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Base64 encoded user-data
params.name: userdata

baremetal.tag_set.description: Set the tag of a bare metal server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/baremetal/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: The tag to assign to this server. This tag is shown in the control panel.
params.name: tag

block.attach.description: Attach a block storage subscription to a VPS subscription. The instance will be restarted. The block storage volume must not be attached to any other VPS subscriptions for this to work.

params.description: ID of the block storage subscription to attach
params.name: SUBID

params.description: ID of the VPS subscription to mount the block storage subscription to
params.name: attach_to_SUBID

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'.  If 'yes', this will be attached to the instance without a restart (requires support from the instance's operating system). (default is 'no')
params.name: live

params.description: DCID of the location to create this subscription in.  See /v1/regions/list
params.name: DCID

params.description: Size (in GB) of this subscription.
params.name: size_gb

params.description: Text label that will be associated with the subscription
params.name: label

block.delete.description: Delete a block storage subscription.  All data will be permanently lost. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: ID of the block storage subscription to delete
params.name: SUBID

block.detach.description: Detach a block storage subscription from the currently attached instance. The instance will be restarted.

params.description: ID of the block storage subscription to detach
params.name: SUBID

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'.  If 'yes', this will be detached from the instance without a restart. (default is 'no')
params.name: live

block.label_set.description: Set the label of a block storage subscription.

params.description: ID of the block storage subscription.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Text label that will be shown in the control panel.
params.name: label

block.list.description: Retrieve a list of any active block storage subscriptions on this account.

params.description: Unique identifier of a subscription. Only the subscription object will be returned.
params.name: SUBID

block.resize.description: Resize the block storage volume to a new size.

params.description: ID of the block storage subscription to resize
params.name: SUBID

params.description: New size (in GB) of the block storage subscription
params.name: size_gb

dns.create_domain.description: Create a domain name in DNS.

params.description: Domain name to create
params.name: domain

params.description: Server IP to use when creating default records (A and MX)
params.name: serverip

params.description: Domain name to add record to
params.name: domain

params.description: Name (subdomain) of record
params.name: name

params.description: Type (A, AAAA, MX, etc) of record
params.name: type

params.description: Data for this record
params.name: data

params.description: TTL of this record
params.name: ttl

params.description: (only required for MX and SRV) Priority of this record (omit the priority from the data)
params.name: priority

dns.delete_domain.description: Delete a domain name and all associated records.

params.description: Domain name to delete
params.name: domain

params.description: Domain name to delete record from
params.name: domain

params.description: ID of record to delete (see /dns/records)
params.name: RECORDID

dns.dnssec_enable.description: Enable or disable DNSSEC for a domain.

params.description: Domain name to update record
params.name: domain

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'.  If yes, DNSSEC will be enabled for the given domain
params.name: enable

dns.dnssec_info.description: Get the DNSSEC keys (if enabled) for a domain.

params.description: Domain from which to gather DNSSEC keys.
params.name: domain

dns.list.description: List all domains associated with the current account.

dns.records.description: List all the records associated with a particular domain.

params.description: Domain to list records for
params.name: domain

dns.soa_info.description: Get the SOA record information for a domain.

params.description: Domain from which to gather SOA information
params.name: domain

dns.soa_update.description: Update the SOA record information for a domain.

params.description: Domain name to update record
params.name: domain

params.description: (Optional) Primary nameserver to store in the SOA record
params.name: nsprimary

params.description: (Optional) Administrative email to store in the SOA record
params.name: email

params.description: Domain name to update record
params.name: domain

params.description: ID of record to update (see /dns/records)
params.name: RECORDID

params.description: Name (subdomain) of record
params.name: name

params.description: Data for this record
params.name: data

params.description: TTL of this record
params.name: ttl

params.description: (only required for MX and SRV) Priority of this record (omit the priority from the data)
params.name: priority

firewall.group_create.description: Create a new firewall group on the current account.

params.description: Description of firewall group.
params.name: description

firewall.group_delete.description: Delete a firewall group. Use this function with caution because the firewall group being deleted will be detached from all servers. This can result in open ports accessible to the internet.

params.description: Firewall group to delete.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

firewall.group_list.description: List all firewall groups on the current account.

params.description: Filter result set to only contain this firewall group.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

firewall.group_set_description.description: Change the description on a firewall group.

params.description: Firewall group to update.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

params.description: Description of firewall group.
params.name: description

firewall.rule_create.description: Create a rule in a firewall group.

params.description: Target firewall group. See /v1/firewall/group_list.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

params.description: Direction of rule. Possible values: "in".
params.name: direction

params.description: IP address type. Possible values: "v4", "v6".
params.name: ip_type

params.description: Protocol type. Possible values: "icmp", "tcp", "udp", "gre".
params.name: protocol

params.description: IP address representing a subnet. The IP address format must match with the "ip_type" parameter value.
params.name: subnet

params.description: IP prefix size in bits.
params.name: subnet_size

params.description: TCP/UDP only. This field can be an integer value specifying a port or a colon separated port range.
params.name: port

params.description: This field supports notes up to 255 characters.
params.name: notes

params.description: If the source string is given a value of "cloudflare" subnet and subnet_size will both be ignored, this will allow all of Cloudflare's IP space through the firewall. Possible values: "", "cloudflare".
params.name: source

firewall.rule_delete.description: Delete a rule in a firewall group.

params.description: Target firewall group. See /v1/firewall/group_list.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

params.description: Rule number to delete. See /v1/firewall/rule_list.
params.name: rulenumber

firewall.rule_list.description: List the rules in a firewall group.

params.description: Target firewall group. See /v1/firewall/group_list.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

params.description: Direction of firewall rules. Possible values: "in".
params.name: direction

params.description: IP address type. Possible values: "v4", "v6".
params.name: ip_type

iso.create_from_url.description: Create a new ISO image on the current account. The ISO image will be downloaded from a given URL. Download status can be checked with the v1/iso/list call.

params.description: Remote URL from where the ISO will be downloaded.
params.name: url

iso.destroy.description: Destroy (delete) an ISO image. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier for this ISO image. These can be found using the v1/iso/list call.
params.name: ISOID

iso.list.description: List all ISOs currently available on this account.

iso.list_public.description: List public ISOs offered in the Vultr ISO library.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Location in which to create the load balancer. See "v1/regions/list".
params.name: DCID

params.description: Text label that will be associated with the subscription.
params.name: label

params.description: Forces redirect from HTTP to HTTPS.
params.name: config_ssl_redirect

params.description: Enables sticky sessions for your load balancer - valid options are on or off.
params.name: sticky_sessions

params.description: Name for your stick session.
params.name: cookie_name

params.description: Balancing algorithm for your load balancer - valid options are roundrobin or leastconn.
params.name: balancing_algorithm

params.description: Enables proxy protocol - valid options are on or off
params.name: proxy_protocol

params.description: The SSL certificates private key.
params.name: ssl_private_key

params.description: The SSL certificate chain.
params.name: ssl_chain

params.description: List which instances you want attached to your load balancer.
params.name: attached_nodes

loadbalancer.destroy.description: Destroy a load balancer subscription. All data will be permanently lost. Web traffic passing through the load balancer will be abruptly terminated. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Endpoint protocol on load balancer side. Possible values: "http", "https", "tcp".
params.name: frontend_protocol

params.description: Endpoint port on load balancer side.
params.name: frontend_port

params.description: Endpoint protocol on instance side. Possible values: "http", "https", "tcp".
params.name: backend_protocol

params.description: Endpoint port on instance side.
params.name: backend_port

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Unique identifier of a forwarding rule. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/forward_rule_list" call.
params.name: RULEID

loadbalancer.forward_rule_list.description: List the forwarding rules of a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

loadbalancer.generic_info.description: Retrieve the generic configuration of a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

loadbalancer.generic_update.description: Update the generic configuration of a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Label of your load balancer
params.name: label

params.description: Balancing algorithm. Possible values: "roundrobin", "leastconn".
params.name: balancing_algorithm

params.description: Enables sticky sessions for your load balancer - valid options are on or off.
params.name: sticky_sessions

params.description: Name for your stick session.
params.name: cookie_name

params.description: Force HTTP to HTTPS.
params.name: ssl_redirect

params.description: (optionals) Enables proxy protocol - valid options are on or off
params.name: proxy_protocol

loadbalancer.health_check_info.description: Retrieve the health checking configuration of a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

loadbalancer.health_check_update.description: Update the health checking configuration of a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Connection protocol. Possible values: "http", "https".
params.name: protocol

params.description: Connection port.
params.name: port

params.description: Time in seconds to perform health check.
params.name: check_interval

params.description: Time in seconds to wait for a health check response.
params.name: response_timeout

params.description: Number of failed attempts encountered before failover.
params.name: unhealthy_threshold

params.description: Number of failed attempts encountered before failover.
params.name: healthy_threshold

params.description: Path to page used for health check. The target page must return an HTTP 200 success code.
params.name: path

loadbalancer.instance_attach.description: Attach an instance to a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of LoadBalancer subscription to attach to.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Unique identifier (SUBID) of VPS or baremetal subscription to attach.
params.name: backendNode

loadbalancer.instance_detach.description: Detach an instance to a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of LoadBalancer subscription to detach from.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Unique identifier (SUBID) of VPS or baremetal subscription to detach.
params.name: backendNode

loadbalancer.instance_list.description: List the instances attached to a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

loadbalancer.label_set.description: Set the label of a load balancer subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Text label that will be shown in the control panel.
params.name: label

loadbalancer.list.description: List all load balancer subscriptions on the current account. This includes both pending and active subscriptions.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. Only the subscription object will be returned.
params.name: SUBID

loadbalancer.ssl_add.description: Add a SSL certificate to a load balancer.

params.description: Unique identifier of LoadBalancer subscription.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: The SSL certificates private key.
params.name: ssl_private_key

params.description: The SSL certificate chain.
params.name: ssl_chain

loadbalancer.ssl_info.description: Retrieve whether or not your load balancer subscription has an SSL cert attached.

params.description: Unique identifier of a load balancer subscription. This can be found using the "v1/loadbalancer/list" call.
params.name: SUBID

loadbalancer.ssl_remove.description: Remove a SSL certificate to a load balancer.

params.description: Unique identifier of LoadBalancer subscription.
params.name: SUBID

network.create.description: Create a new private network. A private network can only be used at the location for which it was created.

params.description: Location for the network. See v1/regions/list.
params.name: DCID

params.description: Description of network.
params.name: description

params.description: IPv4 network to be used when attaching servers to this network.
params.name: v4_subnet

params.description: Network mask corresponding with the v4_subnet.
params.name: v4_subnet_mask

network.destroy.description: Destroy (delete) a private network. Before destroying, a network must be disabled from all instances. See /v1/server/private_network_disable.

params.description: Unique identifier for this network.  These can be found using the v1/network/list call.
params.name: NETWORKID

network.list.description: List all private networks on the current account.

params.description: Cluster to use for object storage. See /v1/objectstorage/list_cluster.
params.name: OBJSTORECLUSTERID

params.description: Text label that will be associated with the subscription.
params.name: label

objectstorage.destroy.description: Destroy an object storage subscription. All objects will be permanently deleted. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/objectstorage/list call.
params.name: SUBID

objectstorage.label_set.description: Set the label of an object storage subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/objectstorage/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Text label that will be shown in the control panel.
params.name: label

objectstorage.list.description: List all object storage subscriptions on the current account. This includes both pending and active subscriptions.

params.description: (optional, default 'yes') 'yes' or 'no'. If 'yes', include S3 keys with each subscription entry.
params.name: include_s3

params.description: Unique identifier of a subscription. Only the subscription object will be returned.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: A text label string. Only subscription objects with this text label will be returned.
params.name: label

objectstorage.s3key_regenerate.description: Regenerate the S3 API keys of an object storage subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/objectstorage/list call.
params.name: SUBID

os.list.description: Retrieve a list of available operating systems.  If the "windows" flag is true, a Windows license will be included with the instance, which will increase the cost.

plans.list.description: Retrieve a list of all active plans. Plans that are no longer available will not be shown.

params.description: The type of plans to return. Possible values: "all", "vc2", "ssd", "vdc2", "dedicated", "vc2z".
params.name: type

plans.list_baremetal.description: Retrieve a list of all active bare metal plans. Plans that are no longer available will not be shown.

plans.list_vc2.description: Retrieve a list of all active vc2 plans. Plans that are no longer available will not be shown.

plans.list_vc2z.description: Retrieve a list of all active high frequency CPU plans. Plans that are no longer available will not be shown.

plans.list_vdc2.description: Retrieve a list of all active vdc2 plans. Plans that are no longer available will not be shown.

regions.availability.description: Retrieve a list of the VPSPLANIDs currently available in this location.

params.description: Location to check availability.
params.name: DCID

params.description: The type of plans for which to include availability. Possible values: "all", "vc2", "ssd", "vdc2", "dedicated".
params.name: type

regions.availability_baremetal.description: Retrieve a list of the METALPLANIDs currently available in this location.

params.description: Location to check availability.
params.name: DCID

regions.availability_vc2.description: Retrieve a list of the vc2 VPSPLANIDs currently available in this location.

params.description: Location to check availability.
params.name: DCID

regions.availability_vdc2.description: Retrieve a list of the vdc2 VPSPLANIDs currently available in this location.

params.description: Location to check availability.
params.name: DCID

regions.list.description: Retrieve a list of all active regions. Note that just because a region is listed here, does not mean that there is room for new servers.

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'. If 'yes', include the current availability with each region entry.
params.name: availability

reservedip.attach.description: Attach a reserved IP to an existing subscription.

params.description: Reserved IP to be attached. Include the subnet size in this parameter (e.g: /32 or /64).
params.name: ip_address

params.description: Unique identifier of the target server.
params.name: attach_SUBID

reservedip.convert.description: Convert an existing IP on a subscription to a reserved IP. Returns the SUBID of the newly created reserved IP.

params.description: SUBID of the server that currently has the IP address you want to convert
params.name: SUBID

params.description: IP address you want to convert (v4 must be a /32, v6 must be a /64)
params.name: ip_address

params.description: Label for this reserved IP
params.name: label

reservedip.create.description: Create a new reserved IP. Reserved IPs can only be used within the same datacenter for which they were created.

params.description: Location to create this reserved IP in.  See v1/regions/list
params.name: DCID

params.description: 'v4' or 'v6' Type of reserved IP to create
params.name: ip_type

params.description: Label for this reserved IP
params.name: label

reservedip.destroy.description: Remove a reserved IP from your account. After making this call, you will not be able to recover the IP address.

params.description: Reserved IP to remove from your account.
params.name: ip_address

reservedip.detach.description: Detach a reserved IP from an existing subscription.

params.description: Reserved IP to be detached. Include the subnet size in this parameter (e.g: /32 or /64).
params.name: ip_address

params.description: Unique identifier of the target server.
params.name: detach_SUBID

reservedip.list.description: List all the active reserved IPs on this account. The "subnet_size" field is the size of the network assigned to this subscription. This will typically be a /64 for IPv6, or a /32 for IPv4.

server.app_change.description: Changes the virtual machine to a different application. All data will be permanently lost.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Application to use. See /v1/server/app_change_list.
params.name: APPID

server.app_change_list.description: Retrieves a list of applications to which a virtual machine can be changed. Always check against this list before trying to switch applications because it is not possible to switch between every application combination.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.backup_disable.description: Disables automatic backups on a server. Once disabled, backups can only be enabled again by customer support.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.backup_enable.description: Enables automatic backups on a server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.backup_get_schedule.description: Retrieves the backup schedule for a server. All time values are in UTC.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.backup_set_schedule.description: Sets the backup schedule for a server. All time values are in UTC.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Backup cron type. Can be one of 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'daily_alt_even', or 'daily_alt_odd'.
params.name: cron_type

params.description: Hour value (0-23). Applicable to crons: 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'daily_alt_even', 'daily_alt_odd'
params.name: hour

params.description: Day-of-week value (0-6). Applicable to crons: 'weekly'.
params.name: dow

params.description: Day-of-month value (1-28). Applicable to crons: 'monthly'.
params.name: dom

server.bandwidth.description: Get the bandwidth used by a virtual machine.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.create.description: Create a new virtual machine. You will start being billed for this immediately. The response only contains the SUBID for the new machine.

params.description: Location to create this virtual machine in. See v1/regions/list.
params.name: DCID

params.description: Plan to use when creating this virtual machine. See v1/plans/list.
params.name: VPSPLANID

params.description: Operating system to use. See v1/os/list.
params.name: OSID

params.description: If you've selected the 'custom' operating system, this can be set to chainload the specified URL on bootup, via iPXE.
params.name: ipxe_chain_url

params.description: If you've selected the 'custom' operating system, this is the ID of a specific ISO to mount during the deployment.
params.name: ISOID

params.description: If you've not selected a 'custom' operating system, this can be the SCRIPTID of a startup script to execute on boot. See v1/startupscript/list.
params.name: SCRIPTID

params.description: If you've selected the 'snapshot' operating system, this should be the SNAPSHOTID (see v1/snapshot/list) to restore for the initial installation.
params.name: SNAPSHOTID

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, an IPv6 subnet will be assigned to the machine (where available).
params.name: enable_ipv6

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, private networking support will be added to the new server.
params.name: enable_private_network

params.description: List of private networks to attach to this server. Use either this field or enable_private_network, not both.
params.name: NETWORKID

params.description: This is a text label that will be shown in the control panel.
params.name: label

params.description: List of SSH keys to apply to this server on install (only valid for Linux/FreeBSD). See v1/sshkey/list. Separate keys with commas.
params.name: SSHKEYID

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, automatic backups will be enabled for this server (these have an extra charge associated with them).
params.name: auto_backups

params.description: If launching an application (OSID 186), this is the APPID to launch. See v1/app/list.
params.name: APPID

params.description: Base64 encoded user-data
params.name: userdata

params.description: (optional, default 'yes') 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, an activation email will be sent when the server is ready.
params.name: notify_activate

params.description: (optional, default 'no') 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, DDOS protection will be enabled on the subscription (there is an additional charge for this).
params.name: ddos_protection

params.description: IP address of the floating IP to use as the main IP of this server.
params.name: reserved_ip_v4

params.description: The hostname to assign to this server.
params.name: hostname

params.description: The tag to assign to this server.
params.name: tag

params.description: The firewall group to assign to this server. See /v1/firewall/group_list.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

server.create_ipv4.description: Add a new IPv4 address to a server. You will start being billed for this immediately. The server will be rebooted unless you specify otherwise. You must reboot the server before the IPv4 address can be configured.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: (optional, default 'yes') 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, the server is rebooted immediately.
params.name: reboot

server.destroy.description: Destroy (delete) a virtual machine. All data will be permanently lost, and the IP address will be released. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.destroy_ipv4.description: Removes a secondary IPv4 address from a server. Your server will be hard-restarted. We suggest halting the machine gracefully before removing IPs.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: IPv4 address to remove.
params.name: ip

server.firewall_group_set.description: Set, change, or remove the firewall group currently applied to a server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. See v1/server/list.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: The firewall group to apply to this server. A value of "0" means "no firewall group". See /v1/firewall/group_list.
params.name: FIREWALLGROUPID

server.get_app_info.description: Retrieves the application information for this subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.get_user_data.description: Retrieves the (base64 encoded) user-data for this subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.halt.description: Halt a virtual machine. This is a hard power off (basically, unplugging the machine). The data on the machine will not be modified, and you will still be billed for the machine. To completely delete a machine, see v1/server/destroy.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.ipv6_enable.description: Enables IPv6 networking on a server by assigning an IPv6 subnet to it. The server will be automatically rebooted to complete the request. No action occurs if IPv6 networking was already enabled. It is possible to check whether or not IPv6 networking has been enabled with v1/server/list_ipv6.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.iso_attach.description: Attach an ISO and reboot the server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the /v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: The ISO that will be mounted. See the /v1/iso/list call.
params.name: ISOID

server.iso_detach.description: Detach the currently mounted ISO and reboot the server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the /v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.iso_status.description: Retrieve the current ISO state for a given subscription. The returned state may be one of: ready | isomounting | isomounted. ISOID will only be set when the mounted ISO exists in your library ( see /v1/iso/list ). Otherwise, it will read "0".

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the /v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.label_set.description: Set the label of a virtual machine.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: This is a text label that will be shown in the control panel.
params.name: label

server.list.description: List all active or pending virtual machines on the current account.

params.description: Unique identifier of a subscription. Only the subscription object will be returned.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: A tag string. Only subscription objects with this tag will be returned.
params.name: tag

params.description: A text label string. Only subscription objects with this text label will be returned.
params.name: label

params.description: An IPv4 address. Only the subscription matching this IPv4 address will be returned.
params.name: main_ip

server.list_ipv4.description: List the IPv4 information of a virtual machine. IP information is only available for virtual machines in the "active" state.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'. If 'yes', include information about the public network adapter (such as MAC address) with the "main_ip" entry.
params.name: public_network

server.list_ipv6.description: List the IPv6 information of a virtual machine. IP information is only available for virtual machines in the "active" state. If the virtual machine does not have IPv6 enabled, then an empty array is returned.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.neighbors.description: Determine what other subscriptions are hosted on the same physical host as a given subscription.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.os_change.description: Changes the virtual machine to a different operating system. All data will be permanently lost.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Operating system to use. See /v1/server/os_change_list.
params.name: OSID

server.os_change_list.description: Retrieves a list of operating systems to which a virtual machine can be changed. Always check against this list before trying to switch operating systems because it is not possible to switch between every operating system combination.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.private_network_disable.description: Removes a private network from a server. The server will be automatically rebooted to complete the request.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Unique identifier for the private network to remove from this subscription. This field is optional if there is only one private network in a given location. See the v1/network/list call.
params.name: NETWORKID

server.private_network_enable.description: Enables private networking on a server. The server will be automatically rebooted to complete the request. No action occurs if private networking was already enabled. It is possible to check whether or not private networking has been enabled with v1/server/list_ipv4.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Unique identifier for the private network to attach to this subscription.  This field is optional if there is only one private network in a given location.  See the v1/network/list call.
params.name: NETWORKID

server.private_networks.description: List private networks attached to a particular server.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.reboot.description: Reboot a virtual machine. This is a hard reboot (basically, unplugging the machine).

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.reinstall.description: Reinstall the operating system on a virtual machine. All data will be permanently lost, but the IP address will remain the same. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: The hostname to assign to this server.
params.name: hostname

server.restore_backup.description: Restore the specified backup to the virtual machine. Any data already on the virtual machine will be lost.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: BACKUPID (see v1/backup/list) to restore to this instance
params.name: BACKUPID

server.restore_snapshot.description: Restore the specified snapshot to the virtual machine. Any data already on the virtual machine will be lost.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: SNAPSHOTID (see v1/snapshot/list) to restore to this instance
params.name: SNAPSHOTID

server.reverse_default_ipv4.description: Set a reverse DNS entry for an IPv4 address of a virtual machine to the original setting. Upon success, DNS changes may take 6-12 hours to become active.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: IPv4 address used in the reverse DNS update. These can be found with the v1/server/list_ipv4 call.
params.name: ip

server.reverse_delete_ipv6.description: Remove a reverse DNS entry for an IPv6 address of a virtual machine. Upon success, DNS changes may take 6-12 hours to become active.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: IPv6 address used in the reverse DNS update. These can be found with the v1/server/reverse_list_ipv6 call.
params.name: ip

server.reverse_list_ipv6.description: List the IPv6 reverse DNS entries of a virtual machine. Reverse DNS entries are only available for virtual machines in the "active" state. If the virtual machine does not have IPv6 enabled, then an empty array is returned.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.reverse_set_ipv4.description: Set a reverse DNS entry for an IPv4 address of a virtual machine. Upon success, DNS changes may take 6-12 hours to become active.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: IPv4 address used in the reverse DNS update. These can be found with the v1/server/list_ipv4 call.
params.name: ip

params.description: reverse DNS entry.
params.name: entry

server.reverse_set_ipv6.description: Set a reverse DNS entry for an IPv6 address of a virtual machine. Upon success, DNS changes may take 6-12 hours to become active.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: IPv6 address used in the reverse DNS update. These can be found with the v1/server/list_ipv6 or v1/server/reverse_list_ipv6 calls.
params.name: ip

params.description: reverse DNS entry.
params.name: entry

server.set_user_data.description: Sets the user-data for this subscription. User-data is a generic data store, which some provisioning tools and cloud operating systems use as a configuration file. It is generally consumed only once after an instance has been launched, but individual needs may vary.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Base64 encoded user-data
params.name: userdata

server.start.description: Start a virtual machine. If the machine is already running, it will be restarted.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription.  These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

server.tag_set.description: Set the tag of a virtual machine.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: The tag to assign to this server. This tag is shown in the control panel.
params.name: tag

server.upgrade_plan.description: Upgrade the plan of a virtual machine. The virtual machine will be rebooted upon a successful upgrade.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

params.description: The new plan. See /v1/server/upgrade_plan_list.
params.name: VPSPLANID

server.upgrade_plan_list.description: Retrieve a list of the VPSPLANIDs for which a virtual machine can be upgraded. An empty response array means that there are currently no upgrades available.

params.description: Unique identifier for this subscription. These can be found using the v1/server/list call.
params.name: SUBID

snapshot.create.description: Create a snapshot from an existing virtual machine.  The virtual machine does not need to be stopped.

params.description: Identifier of the virtual machine to create a snapshot from.  See v1/server/list
params.name: SUBID

params.description: Description of snapshot contents
params.name: description

snapshot.create_from_url.description: Create a new snapshot on the current account. The snapshot will be downloaded from a given URL. Download status can be checked with the v1/snapshot/list call.

params.description: Remote URL from where the snapshot will be downloaded.
params.name: url

snapshot.destroy.description: Destroy (delete) a snapshot. There is no going back from this call.

params.description: Unique identifier for this snapshot.  These can be found using the v1/snapshot/list call.
params.name: SNAPSHOTID

snapshot.list.description: List all snapshots on the current account.

params.description: Filter result set to only contain this snapshot.
params.name: SNAPSHOTID

params.description: Name of the SSH key
params.name: name

params.description: SSH public key (in authorized_keys format)
params.name: ssh_key

sshkey.destroy.description: Remove a SSH key.  Note that this will not remove the key from any machines that already have it.

params.description: Unique identifier for this SSH key.  These can be found using the v1/sshkey/list call.
params.name: SSHKEYID

sshkey.list.description: List all the SSH keys on the current account.

sshkey.update.description: Update an existing SSH Key. Note that this will only update newly installed machines. The key will not be updated on any existing machines.

params.description: SSHKEYID of key to update (see /v1/sshkey/list)
params.name: SSHKEYID

params.description: New name for the SSH key
params.name: name

params.description: New SSH key contents
params.name: ssh_key

params.description: Name of the newly created startup script.
params.name: name

params.description: Startup script contents.
params.name: script

params.description: Type of startup script. Default is 'boot'.
params.name: type

params.description: Unique identifier for this startup script. These can be found using the v1/startupscript/list call.
params.name: SCRIPTID

startupscript.list.description: List all startup scripts on the current account. Scripts of type "boot" are executed by the server's operating system on the first boot. Scripts of type "pxe" are executed by iPXE when the server itself starts up.

params.description: SCRIPTID of script to update (see /v1/startupscript/list).
params.name: SCRIPTID

params.description: New name for the startup script.
params.name: name

params.description: New startup script contents.
params.name: script

params.description: Email address for this user
params.name: email

params.description: Name for this user
params.name: name

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, this user's API key will work on api.vultr.com.  Default is yes
params.name: api_enabled

params.description: List of ACLs that this user should have.  See /v1/user/list for information on possible ACLs
params.name: acls

params.description: ID of the user to delete
params.name: USERID

user.list.description: Retrieve a list of any users associated with this account.

user.update.description: Update the details for a user.

params.description: ID of the user to update
params.name: USERID

params.description: New email address for this user
params.name: email

params.description: New name for this user
params.name: name

params.description: New password for this user
params.name: password

params.description: 'yes' or 'no'. If yes, this user's API key will work on api.vultr.com
params.name: api_enabled

params.description: List of ACLs that this user should have.  See /v1/user/list for information on possible ACLs
params.name: acls
